intro: Scabiosa japonica var. mansenensis, commonly known as Japanese scabious, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. Its delicate appearance and extended blooming period make it a valuable addition to ornamental gardens.
